BVR kill chain: Tranche 1/2/3A backbone with CAPTOR/CAPTOR-E AESA (150-250 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 4-6 Meteor/AIM-120C-7 mixed loads for high-volume BVR; OFP-02/P2E/P3E upgrades (2025 IOC) add AI and drone integration; mid-life extensions to 2030 for volume filler; 17 T1 +32 T2 +20 T3A across 4 squadrons (e.g., Ala 11/14 at Morón/Torrejón), core for NATO QRA with 130-140 km effective envelope via shared E-3A cueing. F2T2EA: CAPTOR-E Find/Fix; Tracks Link-16; Targets Meteor; Engage high-volume; Assess AI.
Associated products: CAPTOR-E AESA radar, Meteor long-range BVR missile, Ground Master 400 radars

BVR kill chain: Upgraded single/two-seat with AN/APG-65(V)2 radar (120 km), 4-8 AIM-120C-7 loads, and ALQ-165 EW; post-2024 crash fleet at 69 fighters +12 trainers; Ala 15 at Zaragoza, excels in maritime BVR with NATO datalinks for 140 km envelope, bridging to Eurofighter full IOC by 2030. BVR kill chain: Multirole with underwing pods for probe refueling, extending BVR sorties by 2+ hours; 13 more on order (delivery 2026+); GR.31 at Zaragoza, enables rapid deployment for surge ops in NATO exercises. F2T2EA: Refueling extends Track/Engage; Deploys surge; Targets basing; Assess probe.

BVR kill chain: MRTT with boom/probe for sustained Typhoon/F-18 BVR patrols; second unit IOC Oct 2025, +1 conversion from ex-Iberia A330; enhances power projection in Indo-Pacific/Med ops via E-7 interoperability. BVR kill chain: Dedicated EW platform with jamming pods to suppress enemy radars, enabling BVR "permission to shoot"; single unit at Torrejón, upgrades in 2025 for GPS-denied support to fighter salvos.
